key_points: Congressmen Peter Meijer and Seth Moulton defend their surprise trip to Kabul amidst criticisms.
The trip was aimed at conducting oversight on the evacuation operation amid the U.S. military withdrawal and Taliban takeover.
The White House claims over 100,000 people were evacuated to safety recently.
Both Meijer and Moulton are veterans and stated their trip aimed to minimize risk and disruption.
Their visit was not pre-announced to minimize the potential risk to operations and people on the ground.
Criticism includes the trip being labelled a dangerous 'freelance' journey by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.
Moulton highlighted the emotional strain on personnel at Kabul airport and critiqued President Biden's preparation for evacuations.
The Biden administration and Pelosi criticized the trip for potentially diverting resources.
Politico reported that the lawmakers paid 'out of pocket' for flights to the United Arab Emirates, then took military flights to and from Kabul.
Moulton and Meijer have stated their opposition to Biden's plan to meet an August 31 deadline for troop withdrawal.
